result.execSummary:
The defendant Celina K. Pietrzyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Celina K. Pietrzyk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Celina K. Pietrzyk was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $250 + costs = 452.50 - taken from bond on deposit with balance to be returned.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Mitchell John Philbin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Celina K. Pietrzyk in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Celina K. Pietrzyk.

Atty Hansen is being - Amend to County order on Count 1 and Dismiss Count 2
ADA agrees with agreement

Def pleas no contest

Has reviewed with Deft.
Requests JT. 
Parties agree to a 1 day trial. 
All motions, jury instruction and verdicts to be filed no later than close of business on August 4th, 2021.

Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Deft understands charges an penalties.
Waives formal reading.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
08:56 AM Defendant Celina K. Pietrzyk in court.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case. 
Copy of criminal complaint. 
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Court inquires on atty. 
Deft has spoke with atty- unable to pay for an atty. 
Atty Hansen is in court room and spks- has time to meet with deft. 
Court spks- Atty Hansen to meet with deft to determine eligibility for public defender. 
Court allows time for deft to spk with Atty.
8:58 AM off record. 
9:10 AM on record.
Atty spks- deft does qualify for representation but needs to complete conflict of interest check.  
DA spks on bond recommendations. 
Atty spks on bond recommendations. 
Court imposes $1,000 signature bond w/conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption or alcohol or controlled substance without a valid Rx and no contact with R.A, except for purposes of exchanging children. 
Court schedules with parties. 
9:14 AM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:55 pm.
